Keigo Kusumegi

CV / Blog(日本語) /

I am a PhD student at Cornell Information Science advised by Dr Yian Yin. Previously, BS and MS at the Graduate School of Systems and Information Engineering in University of Tsukuba, under the guidance of Dr Yukie Sano. My research interests include Network Science, Science of Science, and Computational Social Science.

Email: s2120431 // at //u.tsukuba.ac.jp (University of Tsukuba)
Email: s2120431 // at //u.tsukuba.ac.jp (University of Tsukuba)

2022

    🎉 I was elected as a member of QUAD fellows!

    I participated in the workshop: Reconstructing Network Dynamics from Data: Applications to Neuroscience and Beyond hosted by IPAM, UCLA

  • Aug. 1-2, 2022
    💬 I talked about acknowledgement and science of science at SOCIOECONOMIC NETWORKS AND NETWORK SCIENCE WORKSHOP 2022 hosted at Waseda University.

  • Aug. 1-2, 2022
    🎉 The paper “Dataset of identified scholars mentioned in acknowledgement statements” was accepted from scientific data! Link

  • Jul., 2022
    📎 The article “Dataset of identified scholars mentioned in acknowledgement statements” has been accepted by Scientific Data!

  • Jul. 25-29, 2022
    💬 I will talk about “Identifying acknowledged scholars in open access journals and their networks” at NetSci 2022.

    Our internship project(g-RIPS) achievement were presented at SIAM Minisymposium on Graduate Research in Industry and in National Laboratory Internships, JMM.

    💬 I was invited to speak at the 17th Network Ecology Symposium as the last-year best poster award winner.

2021

  • Nov. 2, 2021
    💬 I presented a lightning talk at Complex Networks2021 about the impact of acknowledged scholars on a citation.

  • Aug. 3, 2021
    💬 I gave a oral presentation at SCIENCE OF INNOVATION AND SUCCESS WORKSHOP as early career talk.

  • Nov. 27, 2021
    presented a poster 📰 at IC2S2: 7th International Conference on Computational Social Science (online). The topic was “with title “Citation and Gender Diversity in Research Acknowledgement Networks With Reciprocity”.

  • Mar. 1, 2021
    presented a poster 📰 with title “Citation networks and gender diversity in reciprocal acknowledgement networks” at 16th Network Ecology Symposium (online) and won the best poster award 🎉.

  • Nov. 27, 2020
    gave a oral presentation 💬 at 7th Satellite on Quantifying Success (online). It was my debut of research presentation 👏, and I talked about “Emergence of reciprocity in research acknowledgement network”

Pulications

Kusumegi, K., Sano, Y. Dataset of identified scholars mentioned in acknowledgement statements. Sci Data 9, 461 (2022). link

Kusumegi K., Sano, Y. 2021. Citations and Gender Diversity in Reciprocal Acknowledgement Networks. Preprint at arXiv:2104.01729 (2021). link
